intro: Dianthus crinitus var. amoenus, commonly known as the sweet william, is a flowering plant native to Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to red and white. The plant typically grows to a height of 15–30 cm and features hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden borders and rock gardens. The flowers are often used in floral arrangements due to their vibrant colors and fragrant scent.
